bibl.author: Herbert J. Bathgate
bibl.title: Letter from Herbert J. Bathgate to Walt Whitman, 31 January 1880
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

dateline.name: Oakenholt
Liscard: Cheshire, England
dateline.note: two sets (4 Vols) sent Feb 19 (three sets gone) all gone March 18 '80

body.p: In a letter which I have just received from Mr Mr. Ruskin he says as follows "I have not time just at present to write such a letter to Mr Mr. Whitman as I should like, will you kindly transmit the value of enclosed cheque to him with request for five copies"—

Mr Mr. Ruskin in his correspondence with me expressed his utter astonishment at what I had told him about your pecuniary position,—which he read of first in an article of mine which I send you by this post—
Will you Kindly send five copies of your last 2 Volume Edition addressed to me as above, for which I enclose a draft upon New York—£10 10/.
It gives me a deep sincere pleasure to write this note, but I should like to say about my article, that I have since
